text.p: The links above are some examples of my code. These are mostly in Python, Javascript, and Arduino.

My Github hosts a variety of code from classes and projects I've worked on over the past year. It includes a Search Engine I wrote in Python for an I School course, an experiment with acoustic barcodes, and Parrot AR Drone scripts that are being developed with other I School students.

The other two links show code I developed while an intern at Google with the Fusion Tables team. One link is to Python code which authenticates the user with OAuth and gives them access to a variety of API methods. It also updates other code writen by the DevRel team to the v1 API.

The final link is to javascript files and mock websites I made as part of my intern project. The most interesting one is a d3 slopegraph. More info on this visualization can be seen under INFO VIS/Slopegraph in this portfolio.

images.caption: The basic slopegraph, comparing Male vs Female Asthama rates in 2007
